diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Ewing’s sarcoma of the pelvis, with metastasis to the lung and mediastinal lymph nodes.
differential_diagnosis: primary diffuse large-B-cell lymphoma of the bone
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis is supported by the presence of large anterior mediastinal lymph nodes, multiple pulmonary masses, and a large destructive pelvic lesion in a young man, along with elevated lactate dehydrogenase and alkaline phosphatase levels. Imaging and biopsy findings, including characteristic cellular features and EWS locus rearrangement, confirmed Ewing’s sarcoma.
